meta.description: Context Sensitive Help language labels for plugin belonging to extension 'nkhyphenation'

languageKey.label: The name of this pattern set. Only used to identify the record in the backend.

By default, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, @, the soft hyphen and the zero width joinder (U+200D) are considered to be the characters that can make up a word. You can add additional characters occuring in words here here. For example in german you might set this to 'äöüß' (without the quotes). This field is not trimmed, so watch your white spaces.
The language these hyphenation patterns are for. You can have multiple pattern sets for each language, but in that case it is undefined which one is chosen.
The string to insert as a hyphen. This should usually be the HTML entity '&shy;', but you could need something else.
The minimal number of characters in a word before the first hyphen might be set.
The minimal number of characters in a word that must be left after the last hyphen is set.
